intro: Boronia viminea var. gracilis, commonly known as slender boronia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in coastal and forested areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species in some regions.
